title: Why are electron affinities of the 18th group electrons 0? - Quora

response.answer_text: 18th group elements, the noble gases like radon, xenon etc already have filled shells, that is , they’ve already achieved what’s called the octet configuration. Ultimately they are stable, and do not have to worry about gaining or losing their electrons, hence their electron affinity.
They have noble gas configuration.Atoms aren't in a need for electrons.The tendency to gain or loose electron is for the attainment of stable configuration.
